newsitem.title: TANZANIA: Tanzania shilling steady on dollar, lower vs stg.
newsitem.headline: Tanzania shilling steady on dollar, lower vs stg.

text.p: The Tanzanian shilling ended the week unchanged against the dollar but weaker against the pound, the Bank of Tanzania (BoT) said on Friday.
The shilling was traded at a commercial mean rate of 624.6900 to the dollar, unchanged from Thursday. Last Friday it stood at 624.2445.
Against the pound the shilling stood at a mean rate of 1054.0098 from 1045.1095 on Thursday.
Dealers said the shilling remained stable for most of the week, defying expectations of a slight appreciation.
"The shilling has been generally flat for most of the week. We were expecting it to appreciate but it seems that is not likely to happen," said one dealer.
Less intervention by the central bank, which had confined its role this week to soaking up excess liquidity, helped to explain the shilling's stability, the dealer said.
Another dealer said the market was flush with dollars as traders were buying shillings to finance business transactions.
